moves.1. e4 c5: The Sicilian. An opening I love and had use to beat him on multiple occasions
moves.2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3: The Najdorf which is my favourite Sicilian variation. I have used it to beat him a lot. No wonder he wanted to use it
moves.6... e6 7. f4 Be7 8. Qf3 Qc7 9. h4: I deviate from the book. Not 9. O-O-O
moves.9... b5: He starts his Q-Side pawn storm
moves.13... Nd7 14. g5: Trying to force an exchange down the h-file
moves.15... e5: attacking the strong e-h pawn island and d4 Knight
moves.16. Nb3 exf4 17. Qxf4 f6: Trying to end the k-side attack
moves.18. Nd5: I had thought of the dubious 18. e5 exchange sac but after ...Bxh1 19. Bg6+ Kd8 20. Rxh1 dxe5 21. Qd2 hxg5 22. Be3 Rc8 23. Nd5 Qd6 24. Nxe7 Qxe7 25. Bb7 Rc7 26 Bxa6 which sacs the exchange but loses a pawn as well and after 26... Rxh4 27. Rxh4 gxh4 Black has 4 passed pawns and these out weigh blacks king being stuck in the center.
moves.18... Bxd5 19. exd5 hxg5 20. hxg5: allows the rook exchange down the h-file
moves.20... Rxh1 21. Rxh1 O-O-O: Removes the chance of an attack on h8
moves.22. g6: The only way to save the pawn
moves.22... Nc5: Wanting exchange knights and try and tie the rook to the back rank
moves.23. Bf5+: This means the king must move closer to the corner and is not as well defended
moves.24. Nxc5+ Qxc5 25. Rh7: Tries to tie the bishop to the back ran and stop the rook's movement
moves.25... Bf8: Qfg1+ falls to Qc1 when if Q's are exchanged white bishop and 3 on 2 pawn Q-side pawn majority wins
moves.26. b3: Provides and escape route for a back rank attack
moves.27. a3 a4 28. b4 Qc4: offers to exchange Q's and free White b-pawn
moves.29. Qxc4 bxc4 30. Kb2 Kb6 31. Kc3 Kb5 32: Offers to exchange rooks and free the Bishop
moves.33. Rxd8 Bxd8 34. Kd4 Kb6: ?? Gives up the c-pawn and means White can win through pawn majority. Better was Bb6+ were black can force draw by three fold or make white lose d-pawn
moves.37. c4 Bb6+ 38. c5 dxc5+ 39. bxc5 Bd8: Black is lost with passed c and d pawns white will win
moves.43... Kb7 44. cxd8=Q: Black resigns after losing a game in a drawn position
